page.title: 05PATERSON/QUARRY TRANSPORT
page.content: {EXTRACTIVE INDUSTY {PATERSONS OF GREENOAKHILL }quarry sand and gravel on the land south of Hamilton Rd., adjacent with Kenmuir RD.They extract 1000tons/day.When clay is reached,they infill with debris,which comes from building sites, industry and shops.Top soil is added and the area returned to agriculture.A bronze age burial ground was found on the site. {TRANSPORT}The A74(London Rd.)meets Hamilton Rd. at Mount Vernon Lights.This road carries heavy traffic.both commuter and commercial in and out of Glasgow.There is an entrance to the M74 at Broomhouse.This gives access to the main road to Carlisle and London and also north to Stirling.It feeds to the M8 at Baillieston Interchange.Local traffic has access to Uddingston.
